heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: The last storm was on 08 October 2025 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (186°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 9.7°C), outside temperature (down 8.5°C), and inside temperature (down 3.6°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 7%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 6561 lux) and cloud levels (up 533 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 7037 lux) and cloud levels (up 510 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 533.2m lower than yesterday, 383.5m lower than the past week, 509.7m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 993m to a maximum of 2630m, averaging 1089.3m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1472.8m and 1599.0m respectively.

summary.summary: Inside; cool or mild temperatures. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, dry and less humid conditions and calm and still conditions are expected. Chance of light rain, occasional overcast conditions, and light levels will be low during the day. High pressure will dominate, leading to stable weather.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (6.6°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
